Identify the people on the bottom and correspond them to the question-marked people in the top drawings. Many drawings will correspond to more than one person, and not all people will be used.
What matters are the people's first names. Each drawing corresponds to a particular first name, which may correspond to multiple people (but at least one). One name will be left over.

Each drawing depicts an English phrase or idiom where the last word is also a first name. Use the number of people with that first name as an index to get two words, which, combined with the one leftover person, will give you the final answer.
